response_parsed.title: Refactoring Edge Runtimes using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to leverage FastAPI and Python 3.12+ to refactor edge runtimes for efficient and modern web applications.
key_points: Utilizing FastAPI, a powerful web framework based on asyncio and PEP 343 (ASGI) standard.
Exploring the benefits of Python 3.12+ features like improved type hinting, variable annotations, and enhanced performance.
Showcasing how to structure and organize edge runtime applications for easy maintenance and scalability.
Demonstrating best practices when building and deploying FastAPI applications on edge runtimes.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
async def get_root():
   return {'Hello': 'World'}
app.get('/')(get_root)

from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from database import SessionLocal, models
as db: Session = SessionLocal()
class Post(Base): ...
app = FastAPI()
@app.post('/posts/')
def create_post(db: Session = Depends(get_db)):
   new_post = Post(title='Hello', content='World')
db.add(new_post)
db.commit()
return {'message': 'Post created'}

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for optimal performance and support of newer features.
FastAPI version 0.74.0 or higher is recommended for this guide.
caveats: Ensure your edge runtime supports Python 3.12+, such as AWS Lambda Layers, Google Cloud Run, or EdgeX Foundry.
Remember to test and optimize your FastAPI applications on edge runtimes before deploying them into production.
